Description: Lip and wall sherd of East Greek (Aeolian?) Middle Wild Goat II pottery plate; light orange clay with much silver mica; glaze fired orange-red; exterior: fugitive white slip, painted bands; interior: traces of slip, band at edge of lip; part of a wild goat to right (neck and head missing); blobs as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding filling ornament and goat, see the dinos from the Louvre E 659. Fabric close to the London dinos group.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.919)
